# b00tl3gRSA2
#picoCTF 
## Descripción
In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566`.

## Pistas 
+ What is e generally?

## Solución
```bash
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/picoctf/crypto]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566
c: 
n: 
e: 
                                                                                                                    
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/picoctf/crypto]
└─$ 
```
```python
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ python           
Python 3.11.2 (main, Feb 12 2023, 00:48:52) [GCC 12.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> c = 
>>> n = 
>>> d = 
>>> e = 65537
>>> m = pow(c, d, n)
>>> m

>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'l\x10\x94\xe7\x14\x85=%\x04\x1e<\xcc\x08\xe3,L\xdd\x87+pgM\xdeG.\x84\x91yU\xe8\xa2/\x99\xd8\xa3~\xbf}\xb9\xe2_1-\xd6\xe3\\\xc9NNh\x00q\x9d\x1d\xbf\x0e8\xd6*\x92."\xf5\x8dQL\x0b\x14\xd1\xe0m5F\x95t\xef\x821\x01t\x07\xf3e\xe9\x9b\x03\x07\x0f\x1f\x8fFnS\xee!9\xe7O\xa2\x8a\x14i\xa3%\x83\xda\x80\x03\xc8\xb5A\xd7\xfd\xa8E:\x1e>\x13\x17\xbb\x0f\xdd..:\xb3\xdf'
>>> m = pow(c, e, n)
>>> m
180638594769037903267909311328535969949661653321164402927482237
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2438125}'
>>> 
```
